Reviews.Title: A compact computer, with a good number of ports.  Recovery disk creation failed, but HP made it right. Processor is ok, not fast
Reviews.Author: Allstar "Allstar"
Reviews.Content: First, understand that this is a small computer, with a small keyboard, and that it may take some getting used to, because of the smaller keys.  I knocked off a couple stars because I had a couple gripes. The first, I thought this hp Pavilion 11-e115nr ll.6 touchscreen notebook came with a "regular" AMD A-6 CPU.  Maybe I missed it, but I did not notice in reading the specs on Amazon that the actual CPU number is AMD A-6 1450, which is basically a 1Ghz quad core, that can step up to around 1.4 or 1.5 Ghz.  Anyway, it is classified as a "tablet processor" on some of the review sites that I visited (post purchase). In applications where one core is actively used, performance may be similar, or possibly less than some Intel Celeron processors, according to my interpretation of ratings I saw on the web.  It is ok for web surfing, and e mail, but definitely not an AMD A6-5200.  So, don't expect a lot of speed.My next gripe, was that the Recovery disk operation failed at 40% into DVD 2 (of 4) twice.  To the credit of hp, hp Customer Support Fed Ex'ed a recovery flash drive, at no charge to me, so thank you, hp for that, and it came fast. Hp Customer Service was very good, and eager to accommodate me.  They even called me back to make sure I had received the recovery flash drive, and that if I had any other questions, that they would be happy to help.  So far, I rate the HP  Customer Service at 5 Stars.Beyond those two issues, this is a pretty nice little computer, with a bright, clear screen and a very good compliment of ports:  2 usb 3, 1 usb2, an HDMI Jack, an RJ45 network jack, monitor jack, card slot, and a combination headphone / microphone jack.There is also a built in microphone next to the webcam.  The web cam provides a good image.  I have not done any heavy duty computing on this yet, such as graphic intensive (game) use, but so far, the computer runs cool, with little or no heat detected on the bottom.  They say it has DTS Sound.  I have not tried the sound yet, except that the onboard speakers are surprisingly clear, and have more audio out than I expected for such a small computer.  So, I rate the sound good, so far.If you are new to Windows 8.1, and have questions; I recommend one of the books on amazon, such as Windows 8.1 for Dummies.  Also, don't hesitate to either google or yahoo your question on the web, as there are many sites that offer support.Happy computing!  allstarUpdate:  4-22-2014:  I have used this computer for a few weeks, and one person had a question as to if it will take a SIM card.  If it does, I am not aware of it, but you could check HP specs by searching the model number on support.hp.com , where you should find a link directing you to the spec page, which I recommend checking out. It does have what looks like an SD card slot, but I have not used it.Also: This computer came with Win 8.1, which I think is a highly recommended feature over Win 8.0Be advised that there is a very substantial update recently released for Win 8.1, KB2919355.  This update is several hundred MB! I am mentioning this as a courtesy, because I had some serious issues with Windows Update not working right, and thought I may have a virus, or root kit, for a while, but it was actually the need for the fixes in this update. When you get this update, it may appear to stall, but don't cancel the update without waiting a considerable period of time, as it is probably downloading, but not displaying correctly during the first half of the download.  You can also watch your hard drive activity light, to indicate activity during the download. The screen may not appear to indicate progress for an extended period of time, but will eventually start to indicate it is nearing completion when it is about half done. Then follow the prompts.  Also, another quirk: This same update, will probably appear, again in your recommended updates (I have mine set to inform me, but let me decide when to install), and when this happens, run it again, it will just add more components, not do the whole long update again.  This may happen a few more times, with the same update number. After you do this major update, you may notice a substantial improvement in the way your computer works.  I noticed improved scrolling in Internet Explorer, better function in windows update, and restored function in Windows Defender (Yes! Win defender is included with Win 8.1 (free anti malware program from Microsoft).Anyway, this is getting long winded, but I am liking this small computer much better since the above described update.  Good luck again - allstar

Reviews.Title: Not THAT bad!
Reviews.Author: Luis
Reviews.Content: I just replaced my 2008 white Macbook for this. Going from OSX to Windows 8 touchscreen was a totally new experience. Windows 8 was pretty interesting for a first-timer like me, but not actually hard. I just needed to get the hang of it some more.Anyway, this laptop is just fine for everyday use, such as e-mail, internet, etc. It looks well-built, the display is vivid and the touchscreen is quite responsive (more so with your finger, than with a stylus). Even the smaller keyboard is still manageable - and I have large hands! As far as the processor goes, it isn't the fastest, but it still does its job. Though I must say, the mouse button is a bit noisy when pressed.Most of the time, I'm online via Chrome and/or using iTunes. So far, no issues with quality or usability. So if you just need a simple laptop for the basics, then I would recommend this. But if high-performance is what you're looking for, I'd say look for something else. This little machine is definitely worth the benefit of the doubt before we judge it too harshly, too quickly.

Reviews.Title: Nothing but trouble
Reviews.Author: Joe Skrote "Joe Skrote"
Reviews.Content: Mine came with a bad video driver that caused the laptop to crash. Screen would freeze and go dark while the power stayed on. If I could get it into safe mode (about one in every five or six boots) it wouldn't crash. Uninstalling the bad AMD video driver in favor of the generic Windows driver would also work for a time, but then AMD software would reinstall the crap driver and laptop would crash again. At the time I'm writing this there is no updated AMD video driver that might fix the problem. Was never able to make recovery disks due to crashes, I now have a half dozen DVD coasters. Tried to make recovery disks in safe mode but HP Recovery Manager said my battery wasn't installed.  When I contacted HP support the website said my warranty had expired. I ordered the laptop less than two weeks ago! Needless to say it's going back. There's a reason why this quad-core laptop is being sold so cheap. I like the look and feel of the HP Pavilion line and may spend the extra $50 to get the next model up. I'd recommend you steer clear of this one though.

Reviews.Title: Nice little lalptop
Reviews.Author: C. J. Pisenti "Cliffdar"
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little 12 iinch compact laptop that I bought for traveling due to it's size and weight.  I'm a somewhat disappointed in the speed it brings up programs.

Reviews.Title: The 11-e115nr laptop is nice
Reviews.Author: Donald Hendrix
Reviews.Content: This unit works well and as advertised.  My only comment is that this AMD A6 series processor could be a little faster but it is much better than older processors.

Reviews.Title: Nice Small Notebook Computer
Reviews.Author: Virginia T.
Reviews.Content: It is small, it is a touch screen, and it is powerful enough for emails and doing Microsoft Word/Excel work.  Obviously it is not design to play games.

Reviews.Title: No complains
Reviews.Author: Hector Tapiero
Reviews.Content: Great deal, fast delivery.Great quality/price product. Needed to get used to the touch screen and windows 8. Overall, it is a great purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good inexpensive laptop for a 12-year-old
Reviews.Author: NTC
Reviews.Content: This laptop is very good for my son.  We purchased first http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00FCK20SI/ref=oh_details_o04_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc;=1 which was not good at all.  Then I spotted this one which has quad core and 4GB memory which is very good for this size.  My son loves it.  It runs well with no problem.  He can watch Netflix, YouTube without any problem.  He set everything up.  I didn't help him at all.  He said he loves it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome laptop for everyday use
Reviews.Author: HP pavilion
Reviews.Content: Its really awesome laptop at the price of $279. The touchscreen is very sensitive. I would recommend as budget laptop.
